records.location_details: Migrants apprehended near Gjirokaster, Albania, then transported to the Albania-Greece border near Kakavia and forced to cross into Greece. Later captured by Greek authorities near Mayropoulo and transported to BCU Delvinaki A, Greece.
records.where_clear: Albania-Greece border near Kakavia, Mayropoulo, Delvinaki A
records.location_text_raw: near Gjirokaster; border with Greece near Kakavia; BCU Delvinaki A; Mayropoulo
records.geocodable_query: Gjirokaster, Albania; Kakavia border crossing; Mayropoulo, Greece; Delvinaki A, Greece

possible_violations.legal_basis: Art. 4 of Protocol no. 4 of the European Convention on Human Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: The SIR alleges Albanian authorities transported migrants to the border with Greece and coerced them to cross, using force. The Fundamental Rights Office could not assess the veracity of these allegations, including the use of force and transport to the border, but noted consistency with similar allegations in other SIRs.
records.evidence_quote: three interviewed migrants travelling as part of a group of 16 claimed to have been apprehended by Albanian authorities near Gjirokaster on 19/03/2022 and subsequently brought to the border with Greece near Kakavia.
